concepts.title: Arc, Chord and Types of Arcs
concepts.content: A chord divides a circle into two arcs. The smaller arc is the minor arc and the larger is the major arc. If two arcs together make a complete circle, they are corresponding arcs. A diameter creates two equal semicircular arcs, each measuring 180Â°.

examples.text: Chord AB divides circle: smaller = minor arc AXB, larger = major arc AYB
Bangle breaks at A and B: each piece is an arc
Diameter RT: two equal semicircular arcs, each 180Â°
Arc AXB and arc AYB are corresponding arcs (together = complete circle)

keyPoints: Chord divides circle into two arcs
Corresponding arcs: two arcs that together form a complete circle
Diameter creates two equal semicircular arcs of 180Â° each

concepts.title: Central Angle and Measure of Arc
concepts.content: A central angle is an angle whose vertex is the centre of the circle. The measure of an arc equals the measure of its corresponding central angle. Measure of major arc = 360Â° - measure of minor arc. A complete circle measures 360Â°. Semicircular arc = 180Â°.
